Class SuspiciousMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.SuspiciousMovement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MovementStrategy

    public class SuspiciousMovement
extends java.lang.Object
implements MovementStrategy
    Implements the movement strategy of a suspicious guard.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeDirection()
      Sets the moveForward attribute to true or false.
      int getDirection(char[][] table, int X, int Y)
      Returns the direction of movement, taking into account that the moveForward variable may change.

      Given the 'direction' parameter, returns the opposite direction.

      Updates the movIndex according to the moveForward value.

    • Method Detail

      • changeDirection

        public void changeDirection()
        Sets the moveForward attribute to true or false. This method has about 75% chance to set moveForward as true and 25% to set it as false.

      • invertMovement

        public int invertMovement(int direction)
        Given the 'direction' parameter, returns the opposite direction.
        Parameters:
        direction -
        Returns:
        the opposite direction of the parameter

      • updateMovIndex

        public void updateMovIndex()
        Updates the movIndex according to the moveForward value.
